meanings.sent1: He will hurl the ball to me.
meanings.sent2: She likes to hurl the frisbee at the park.
meanings.sent3: The monkey decided to hurl the banana at the zookeeper.
meanings.sent4: The storm will hurl branches across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The angry chef will hurl the plate into the sink.

meanings.sent1: The hurl of the rock echoed in the canyon.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player's hurl reached the catcher perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The hurl of the snowball hit the target with a thud.
meanings.sent4: The hurl of the javelin broke the previous record.
meanings.sent5: The hurl of the spear was precise and powerful.

meanings.sent1: She felt sick and had to hurl in the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: He had to hurry to the toilet to hurl.
meanings.sent3: The bumpy car ride made her want to hurl.
meanings.sent4: The bad smell made him almost hurl on the spot.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster made her stomach churn, and she had to hurl.
